required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Female Sex is an Independent Predictor of Death and Bleeding Among Fibrinolytic Treated Patients With AMI
clinical_study.official_title: Female Sex is an Independent Predictor of Death and Bleeding Among Fibrinolytic Treated Patients With AMI; Results of the Global Utilization of Streptokinase and Tissue Plasminogen Activator for Occluded Coronary Arteries - V Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluated differences between men and women in the presentation, management and outcome of heart attacks within the GUSTO V study.

detailed_description.textblock: The Global Use of Strategies to Open Occluded Arteries in Acute Coronary Syndromes (GUSTO) V trial examined a large, contemporary cohort of women and men with ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) treated with fibrinolytic therapy. The objective of the present study was to evaluate sex differences in presentation, management and outcome in GUSTO V.

primary_outcome.description: All cause mortality at 30 days after randomization.

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of myocardial reinfarction as evidenced by new electrocardiographic changes or elevation in cardiac enzyme levels with recurrent chest pain within 7 days, bleeding, stoke, intracranial hemorrhage (ICH), and complications of MI.

intervention.intervention_name: fibrinolytic therapy or combination reduced fibrinolytic therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- inclusion into GUSTO V
Exclusion Criteria:
- lack of availability of data (database study)

reference.citation: Topol EJ; GUSTO V Investigators. Reperfusion therapy for acute myocardial infarction with fibrinolytic therapy or combination reduced fibrinolytic therapy and platelet glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibition: the GUSTO V randomised trial. Lancet. 2001 Jun 16;357(9272):1905-14.

Lincoff AM, Califf RM, Van de Werf F, Willerson JT, White HD, Armstrong PW, Guetta V, Gibler WB, Hochman JS, Bode C, Vahanian A, Steg PG, Ardissino D, Savonitto S, Bar F, Sadowski Z, Betriu A, Booth JE, Wolski K, Waller M, Topol EJ; Global Use of Strategies To Open Coronary Arteries Investigators (GUSTO). Mortality at 1 year with combination platelet glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibition and reduced-dose fibrinolytic therapy vs conventional fibrinolytic therapy for acute myocardial infarction: GUSTO V randomized trial. JAMA. 2002 Nov 6;288(17):2130-5.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: New York University School of Medicine
